title: How to Change Location of Facebook: Profile, Page, & Posts

steps.title: Tap your profile photo in the Facebook mobile app.
steps.content: Tap your profile photo in the Facebook mobile app. It's at the top-left corner of the screen in the Facebook app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. This will take you to your Facebook profile. [1] X Research source You can also get to your FB profile by tapping Menu at the bottom of the Facebook app and tapping your name at the top.

steps.title: Tap the Edit profile button.
steps.content: Tap the Edit profile button. It's near the top of your profile, just below the option to add to your Facebook story.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Edit your About info.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Edit your About info . It's all the way at the bottom. This opens your About page.

steps.title: Tap the pencil icon next to your current city.
steps.content: Tap the pencil icon next to your current city. You'll see your cities under "Places lived." Tap the pencil icon next to the city you want to change. If you don't have a city set as your current city, tap the Add city button instead. If you want to remove your current city completely, tap Remove at the bottom.

steps.title: Replace the current city with a new location.
steps.content: Replace the current city with a new location. Tap the current city's name, and that will bring up a search screen. From there, backspace or delete the text, then start typing the name of your new location. When it appears in the search results, tap to select it.

steps.title: Choose who can see your city.
steps.content: Choose who can see your city. Your current location is public by default, but you can change it if you'd like. Tap the small menu just above the city name and choose an option, such as Friends if you only want your friends to see the city, or Only me if you want to keep it private. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Save to save your changes.
steps.content: Tap Save to save your changes. Your current city in the About section of your profile is now up to date.

steps.title: Open your Facebook profile.
steps.content: Open your Facebook profile. You can update your location on Facebook from your profile. To get there from the news feed, just click your name and photo at the upper-left corner of Facebook. If you're browsing a Facebook group, a Facebook Page, or a friend's profile, click your profile photo in the upper-right corner, then click your name to jump to your profile.

steps.title: Click the Edit Profile button.
steps.content: Click the Edit Profile button. It's in the upper-right area of your profile, below your cover image .

steps.title: Click the Edit Your About Info button.
steps.content: Click the Edit Your About Info button. If you don't see it, scroll down a little–it's at the bottom of the window. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Places Lived tab.
steps.content: Click the Places Lived tab. It's in the "About" panel on the left side of the page.

steps.title: Click the three horizontal dots next to your current city ••• .
steps.content: Click the three horizontal dots next to your current city ••• . This is on the right side of the page.

steps.title: Click Edit Current City on the menu.
steps.content: Click Edit Current City on the menu. This option makes it possible to enter a new city into the box.

steps.title: Replace the existing city with a new one.
steps.content: Replace the existing city with a new one. Simply click in the box, backspace or delete over the city name, and enter your new town or city name. As you type, search results will appear. When you see the city you want to use, click it to select it. Can't find your city? You can ask Facebook to add it .

steps.title: Click the blue Save button.
steps.content: Click the blue Save button. Your new location now appears on your Facebook profile. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Change who can see your location.
steps.content: Change who can see your location. The icon next to your location represents the visibility of your location. To control who can see your location: Hover the mouse cursor over the privacy icon to the right of your city's name—the icon is either a globe (public), a lock (only you can see it), two overlapping profile heads (only your friends can see it, or friends except acquaintances if one head is dimmer), two overlapping cards (acquaintances), or a gear (custom). Click the icon to expand the options. Select a new visibility option, such as Friends (which means only people you're friends with can see your current city on your profile). [5] X Research source

steps.title: Switch to the Page you want to edit.
steps.content: Switch to the Page you want to edit. If you run a Facebook Page for a business or other place with a physical location, you can easily change the address in the Facebook app. If your Page is linked to your business's Instagram account, this will also update your location on Instagram's map. [6] X Research source To get there in the FB mobile app: Tap the menu in the Facebook app. Tap Pages. If you don't see it, scroll down and tap See more. Select your Page. When prompted, tap Switch to open your Page. On a computer: Click your profile photo at the top right. Click the name of your page. If you don't see it, click See all profiles , then select your Page. Click Switch in the left panel, then click Switch again.

steps.title: Open your Page's About page.
steps.content: Open your Page's About page. If you're using the mobile app, tap About above your posts. On a computer, click the About tab at the top of your Page. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap See your About info (mobile only).
steps.content: Tap See your About info (mobile only). You can skip this step if you're using a computer.

steps.title: Choose to add or edit your address.
steps.content: Choose to add or edit your address. If you don't have an address listed, click or tap Add Address or Add your address . If you already have an address listed, select the pencil icon to edit it.

steps.title: Enter your location details.
steps.content: Enter your location details. Once you type an address, a map will appear. And as you will notice, the address will not be very accurate.

steps.title: Adjust the pin on the map to show the correct address.
steps.content: Adjust the pin on the map to show the correct address. Click or drag the red pushpin until it's over the correct location on the map.

steps.title: Click or tap Save to update your location.
steps.content: Click or tap Save to update your location. This saves your new address to your Facebook Page.

steps.title: Scroll to the post that has the wrong.
steps.content: Scroll to the post that has the wrong. If you added the wrong location when posting to Facebook, changing the location is easy. You can use these steps to change the location on any platform, including on your phone or tablet. You can also use this method to change the location of a photo.

steps.title: Click or tap the three dots on the post ••• .
steps.content: Click or tap the three dots on the post ••• . A menu will expand. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Select Edit post.
steps.content: Select Edit post . This opens your post for editing.

steps.title: Click or tap the location icon.
steps.content: Click or tap the location icon. It's the compass arrow if you're using a computer, or the pushpin icon if you're using a phone or tablet. [9] X Research source If you don't see one of these options, click or tap the location itself. This should bring up the option to replace the town with a new one. If you want to remove the location completely, click or tap the X or Remove . [10] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a new location and select Save.
steps.content: Enter a new location and select Save . This updates the location on the Facebook post.

steps.title: Make sure your location settings are correct (mobile).
steps.content: Make sure your location settings are correct (mobile). If you're having trouble with your location on Facebook, such as Facebook thinking you are somewhere you aren't, it may be because your location settings are disabled for Facebook. Make sure location services are enabled on your device: iPhone/iPad [11] X Research source Open the settings app. Go to Settings > Privacy & Security > Location Services . Enable Location Services if disabled. Scroll down and tap Facebook . Select when to allow Facebook access to your location, such as While Using the App or Always . Android [12] X Research source Open your Settings and select Location . If Location is off, turn it on. Tap App permissions or App location permissions . [13] X Research source Select Facebook and give it permission to access your location. If you don't see this option, go back to settings and select Apps > Facebook . You should see the option to change location permissions here. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Turn off your VPN.
steps.content: Turn off your VPN. If Facebook thinks you are in the wrong location, it might serve you ads from other places, list the wrong distances for businesses, show your location improperly on maps, and affect your searches. This usually happens when you're using a VPN with an IP address in another region. Disabling your VPN should fix this problem.

steps.title: If you can't change your Page address, you may not have permission.
steps.content: If you can't change your Page address, you may not have permission. Your Facebook account must have Full Control or Partial Control access to be able to edit the location on a Facebook Page. If your account only has task access (for example, if you create content for the Facebook Page using another Meta management tool), you can't change the location. [15] X Research source
